meanings.def: to mix with a liquid and become part of it
examples: Heat gently until the sugar dissolves.
The aspirin hasn't dissolved completely yet.

meanings.def: to make a solid become part of a liquid
to officially end a marriage, business agreement or parliament
examples: The election was announced and parliament was dissolved.
The civilian government was effectively dissolved.
Their marriage was formally dissolved last year.

meanings.def: to disappear; to make something disappear
examples: When the ambulance had gone, the crowd dissolved.
The lights in the windows faded and the house dissolved into darkness again.
dissolve something His calm response dissolved her anger.

meanings.def: to suddenly start laughing, crying, etc.
examples: When the teacher looked up, the children dissolved into giggles.
Every time she heard his name, she dissolved into tears.

meanings.def: to remove or destroy something, especially by a chemical process; to be destroyed in this way
examples: dissolve something (away) a new detergent that dissolves stains
dissolve (away) All the original calcium had dissolved away.
The limestone has simply dissolved away.
